## Equations  

\begin{equation}
\mathrm{Re} = \frac{\rho u L}{\mu} = \frac{u L}{\nu}
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
R_n = R_s (1 - \alpha) + \varepsilon_s R_{ld} - R_{lu}  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
R_{lu} = \varepsilon_s \sigma T_s^4  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
R_{ls} = \varepsilon_a \sigma T_a^4  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
R_{n} = G + H + L_{e}E  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
\mathrm{Bo} = \frac{H}{L_{e}E}  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
E = \frac{(1 - c_R) \frac{R_n}{L_e}}{1 + \mathrm{Bo}}  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
T_v = T (1 + 0.61 q)
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
\overline{u} = \frac{R_H^q S_0^{1/2}}{n}  
\end{equation}  

where $q = \frac{2}{3}$

\begin{equation}
P_e = \frac{(P - 0.2 S)^2}{P + 0.8 S}  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
S = \frac{1000}{CN} - 10  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
\mathrm{CN(I)} = \frac{4.2\ \mathrm{CN(II)}}{10 - 0.058\ \mathrm{CN(II)}}  
\end{equation}  

\begin{equation}
\mathrm{CN(III)} = \frac{23\ \mathrm{CN(II)}}{10 + 0.13\ \mathrm{CN(II)}}  
\end{equation}
